blocks.text: Spyware secretly collects information about users, such as browsing habits, credentials, or keystrokes. Victims may not notice obvious symptoms at first.
Indicators of spyware include increased network traffic to unknown destinations, frequent pop-up advertisements, and changes to browser settings.
Bloatware refers to unnecessary software installed on systems, often consuming resources and introducing additional attack surface.
While bloatware is not always malicious, it can degrade performance and create opportunities for exploitation if it contains vulnerabilities.
